intro: Wiestia floridana, commonly known as the Florida wiestia, is a rare flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, velvety leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and thrives in partial shade. Its blooming season occurs in late spring to early summer, producing clusters of pink to purple flowers. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
